page.title: 11THE ELDERLY IN ERITH 1985
page.content: Erith has a small cottage hospital in Park Crescent with 31 beds. Many old people like it because it is small and has a family atmosphere. Some elderly patients spend the last few months or years of their life there. Holmeleigh is a residential home for the elderly in Avenue Road. It is bright and cheerful and is home for 61 people. They are happy living there and have plenty to do, e.g. sewing, reading, watching T.V. or listening to the radio. Volunteers come in and provide entertainment. Many elderly people still live in their own homes with family or alone. The Home Help Service provides people to help with housework or shopping. Meals on wheels provide many old people with a cooked meal at lunchtime. There is a Pop in Parlour in Erith.
